question: Which category of citizens of the prescribed age may be registered as a vote?
explanation: The Indian citizenship and the Constitution of India faciliate single citizenship for all of India. There is a form of Indian nationality holders which are known as Overseas Citizens of India. The provisions related to citizenship upon adoption of the constitution are contained in Articles 5 to 11 in Part II of the Indian Constitution. The Constitution of India prohibits dual citizenship, except for minors where the 2nd nationality was involuntarily acquired. The Central Indian Government, on application, may register any person as an Overseas Citizen of India if that person is of Indian Origin & is from a country which permits dual citizenship in some form.
